remarks: The set of functionals with closed kernels is a subspace.  Part of proof of Theorem 3.6 of [Holland95] p. 218, line 20, stating "The f_M that arise this way generate a subspace F of E'".  Our proof was suggested by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2015.  (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lclkr.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lclkr.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkr.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkr.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lclkr.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lclkr.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lclkr.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` D ) $.
lclkr.c $e |- C = { f e. F | ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) ) = ( L ` f ) } $.
lclkr.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lclkr $p |- ( ph -> C e. S ) $.
$d ._|_ f $.
$d D f $.
$d F f $.
$d L f $.
$d U f $.
